item.title: Using a Poetry environment in Visual Studio Code's Python Interactive window
item.description: tl;dr – If you manage your project’s dependencies with Poetry, develop in Visual Studio (VS) Code, and use VS Code’s Python interactive window, you can use the poetry-monorepo extension to select your project’s poetry environment as the interactive kernel. What is poetry? Poetry is a slick package builder and dependency manager for python projects. It helps project contributors specify and setup their Python environment. Say you are working on a python project and need to incorporate a non-standard library, such as pandas.

item.title: About Bryan
item.description: I’m a meteorologist turned data scientist. In graduate school I studied how feature engineering and machine learning could improve wind forecasts–picking up Python, R, SQL, and data science along the way. After graduate school I joined Kyruus Health, where I dove into data engineering, the cloud (GCP and AWS), dbt, and people/project leadership. Currently I’m an AI Architect at Insight, where I design and build AI/ML-powered applications. From five to nine I’m spending time with my amazing family, working out, playing sports, listening to instrumental rock, drumming, and enjoying all the Pacific Northwest has to offer.
